docs.snippet: IRONY: "Distant Point," a play written six years ago by the Soviet author, Alexander Afinogenoff, has been enjoying a popular run in London's Westminster Theatre. One matinee was interrupted last week by an announcement. The 41-year-old dramatist who...
docs.lead_paragraph: IRONY: "Distant Point," a play written six years ago by the Soviet author, Alexander Afinogenoff, has been enjoying a popular run in London's Westminster Theatre. One matinee was interrupted last week by an announcement. The 41-year-old dramatist who had written the play as a warning of military aggression had been killed in an air raid while on government duty in Moscow.

docs.snippet: Society was well represented in the boxes at the National Horse Show in Madison Square Garden last night, a gala performance with the vast audience applauding the military thrills in the ring.
